page.title: 11SUMMERLEY HOUSE, UNSTONE.
page.content: Mr. William Marshall, age 52, former professional football player, now pig farmer. "Father-in-law bought old colliery buildings in 1940, & set up farm.Only 3 of original buildings left, coke ovens, b/smith's shop & engine house, all now listed buildings. "50-60 sows & about 500 fat pigs.Till 1984, contracted to supply Walls, at Hyde, Manchester. Used to take bakery waste from Gunstone's, at Dronfield. Now raising different kind of smaller pig. At 160 lbs. sent for butchering. "Two men employed; cleaning out most of mornings. New pit for slurry, which farmers spread on fields. Muck a problem; chemical fertilizers lowered demand. Some used on local allotments. "Pig trade not very good. Need to increase breeding stock to 80 so that we do not have to buy in.Future poor."
